entry.title: Re: Optimizing Data Movement in SAP Datasphere: Replication Flow or Remote Table Replication?
entry.content:
@paddyw Yes — when you use Replication Flow in SAP Datasphere with a database table as the source (for example from SAP HANA Cloud, ABAP-based systems like S/4HANA or ECC, or supported DB connectors), a database trigger (or equivalent change tracking mechanism) is typically created on the source system to capture changes.
Just to Note:

  • If you configure replication in “Initial Load only” mode, then triggers are not kept, since there’s no ongoing delta capture.

  • If you configure “Initial + Delta”, then yes, triggers (or equivalent) will be created and maintained until replication is stopped.

entry.title: Protecting Privileged Information in ITSM and CCM
entry.content:
We occasionally have users include privileged information (e.g., passwords, keys) in plain text in ITSM or CCM documents/transactions. Obviously (to me, at least), they shouldn't do that. I had a user ask if there is a way to secure such information in an ITSM or CCM document. As far as I know, there isn't anyway to do so. A couple of options I did suggest were to provide the information directly to the support team, or to attach a password-protected/encrypted document.

Does anyone know of a way to secure privileged information in an ITSM or CCM document?

entry.title: Re: Error "Missing Customizing in table TFK028G (CAMT053...
entry.content:
Hi Jochem,

as we discussed the key is to 'Assign External Transaction Types to Posting Rules' with the respective sign -/+ in the customizing for the electronic account statement (V_T028G). After that you should maintain the missing entry in 'Define Transactions for Electronic Bank Statement Transfer', which are used in transaction FPB7.

Kind Regards,

Tobias

entry.title: Re: Change existing ANID to New ANID after registration o...
entry.content:
https://connectsupport.ariba.com/sites#item-view&/KB0990626

It is not possible to manually change or add a ANID as NetworkId.

When you send supplier registration invitation, supplier user creates a new account on Business Network or login using an existing account. This is the process when the ANID is associated to supplier as a NetworkId in Ariba Strategic Sourcing.

The "workaround" to do it is to unlink the public supplier user and ANID first and then, inviting the supplier again so that they will be able to link (login with the correct existing account) the ANID as required.

This article will help you: https://me.sap.com/notes/KB0395564

entry.title: Integrated Enterprise Planning: How SAP SAC and SAP IBP Create Optimal, Executable Plans Together
entry.content:
The Business Scenario: BestRun Bikes

Our starting point is the fictional bicycle company "BestRun Bikes" with global distribution of mountain bikes, cruise bikes, and e-bikes. The analysis reveals an interesting market gap: While e-bikes are very successful in the USA, they are completely missing from the German portfolio. This is exactly where our integrated planning approach comes in.

Technical Architecture: The Best of Both Worlds

SAP Analytics Cloud: Finance & Controlling Excellence

  • Target Setting with dynamic planning functions
  • Seasonality Transfer between markets via Deep Copy
  • Gross Margin Calculation with S/4HANA integration
  • Financial Consolidation down to P&L level

SAP Integrated Business Planning: Supply Chain Optimization

  • Demand Planning with constraint-based algorithms
  • Supply Planning with multi-scenario optimization
  • Capacity Planning across network topologies
  • Decision Assistance for scenario evaluation

Integration: Bidirectional Connection between IBP and SAC

The key lies in the built-in bidirectional data integration between SAC and IBP. This enables movement data and master data management and provides automated transfer of planning targets (Demand) and validated capacity plans (Supply) and consensus with financial planning and controlling – without manual interface programming.

Process idea Step-by-Step

Step 1: Baseline Analysis (SAC)

Dashboard: Company Current State

- Gross Revenue by Product: Mountain Bikes, Cruise Bikes, Commuter eBikes

- Geographic Split: Germany vs. USA

- Identification: Germany = 0 eBike Revenue

 

Step 2: Target Setting (SAC)

Planning Model: Revenue Target Setting

- New Estimate: 350 Million EUR for eBikes Germany

- Seasonality Transfer: USA → Germany (Deep Copy, including seasonalities, with shifts if needed)

- Distribution and Allocation Logic: Proportional with Distribute function

- Automatic Gross Margin Calculation in SAP Analytics Cloud

 

 

Step 3: Integrated Connection from SAC to IBP

Integration Layer: SAC → IBP

- Automated Data Management in SAC

- Target Values → Demand Planning Module

- Refresh of IBP Planning Workspaces

 

 

Step 4: Supply Optimization (IBP)

Decision Assistance Scenarios:

- Base Version/Extra Shift: 98.46M Gross Profit

- Base Version/Capacity Reallocation: 100.92M Gross Profit 

- Base Version/Delayed Production: 98.38M Gross Profit

- Contract Manufacturing Evaluation

 

Step 5: Validated Plan Return (Data Management)

Integration Layer: IBP → SAC

- Optimized Capacity Plan → Current Plan Promotion

- Automated Variance Calculation (Δ = 0 after Promotion)

- Finance Current Plan Update for P&L Integration

 

Step 6: Advanced Analytics: Monte Carlo Simulation with SAP Analytics Cloud Compass

A highlight of the solution is the risk-based plan validation through SAP Analytics Cloud Compass:

 

Driver Model Definition

Critical Planning Drivers for the SAC Planning Model:

- Sales Volumes (Volume Driver)

- Prices (Price Driver)

- Capacity Utilization (Capacity Utilization)

- Material Costs (Material Cost Driver)

- Logistics Costs (Logistics Cost Driver)

Simulation Configuration

Monte Carlo Parameters:

- Iterations: 10,000 scenarios

- Driver Variations: Realistic ranges

- Output Target: Operating Result

Simulation Results:

- Realistic Case: 90% probability for 84,000-118,000 USD

- Pessimistic Case: 67,024 USD (5% quantile)

- Optimistic Case: 135,470 USD (95% quantile)

 

Quantified Benefits

  • Planning Time: Drastic reduction through better integration of sub-plans and LoBs
  • Planning Quality: Understanding success probability instead of "gut feeling"
  • Integration: One system, one truth instead of Excel loops
  • Agility: Real-time scenario updates instead of static plans

Eliminated Pain Points

  • Manual coordination between departments
  • Excel-based planning loops
  • Plans without feasibility checks
  • Risk assessment based on assumptions

Conclusion

The combination of SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Integrated Business Planning impressively demonstrates what modern enterprise planning can look like: Integrated, automated, and risk-validated.

Instead of isolated tool landscapes, a coherent planning ecosystem emerges that connects strategic ambitions with operational feasibility.

entry.title: Suggestion required for implementing DPC (Dynamic Period Control) for system migration (EBF)
entry.content:
Hello friends,

We are working on a greenfield project where ERP billing is being migrated from a legacy system to SAP S4.

As per the market regulations, actual read comes in every 6 months (or 2 months for some cases), but we still need to bill the customer on monthly basis. We are planning to implement DPC and backbill all the periods in between two actual reads. 

However, we are going to use EBF (Easy bill calculation framework) to fetch the last 6 months bills generated in the legacy system. Hence, it would create manual bill docs in the new S4 system. As DPC doesn't work on the manual bills, we are also planning to keep the historical estimated consumptions (fetched from the legacy system) in installation facts. 

How can I use the consumptions stored in the installation facts for DPC bill generation (bill category 3000)? As those are the consumption values from correction periods which are originally from the legacy system, we want DPC bill (bill category 3000) to use those values.

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to combine both IM & WM outbound deliv...
entry.content: Hi SAP, We're currently facing an issue when trying to combine a warehouse-managed (WM) outbound delivery and an inventory-managed (IM) outbound delivery into a single freight order — both with their respective freight units. We’re using external Freight Units (planned in an external system), though we’re not sure if that’s influencing the behavior here. When we try to create a freight order that includes one Freight Unit from a WM outbound delivery and one from an IM outbound delivery, we receive the following error: "source and destination location do not match." Does this mean that IM and WM freight units can only be combined into a single freight order if they share the same stage — meaning the same shipping point and destination? If so, that would imply we can only ship to one customer per freight order in this case. Thanks in advance for the clarification.

entry.title: 2025 SAP Digital Manufacturing Assets: IVJs, videos and blog posts
entry.content:
In this blog post, you can find all my digital assets, including Interactive Value Journeys (aka IVJs), videos and other blog posts, created in 2025. You can also check:

  • SAP Digital Manufacturing Assets: IVJs, videos and blog posts
  • 2024 SAP Digital Manufacturing Assets: IVJs, videos and blog posts

In order to better navigate it and find any specific content you might be looking for, I highly suggest you use Find (CTRL+F). Example:

IVJs - Interactive Value Journeys

  1. Get Insights by "Just Ask" for Manufacturing Data

Videos

  1. 3rd Party Supplier production reporting to SAP Digital Manufacturing via Custom POD and Public APIs
  2. Historical OEE Report based on OEE MDO and Embedded SAC within SAP Digital Manufacturing
  3. AI Agents in Manufacturing
  4. Manufacturing AI Agents: Rework AI Copilot

Blog Posts

  1. Call SAP Digital Manufacturing Production Processes via REST API

  11. SFC-Based Dispatching in REO: Granular Production Scheduling and Process Industry Support
  12. How SAP Digital Manufacturing Simplifies Tool Management
  13. Track Quality and Compliance with SAP Digital Manufacturing Reports
  14. Automating Quality Control: Rework Routing Disposition in SAP Digital Manufacturing
  15. How SAP Digital Manufacturing Supports Sustainable Manufacturing

  17. Assembly of Unplanned (non-BOM) Materials
  18. SAP Digital Manufacturing Learning
  19. Using DM Packing Unit as Handling Unit when posting Goods Receipt to EWM
  20. Enforce required Data Collections upon Operation Complete within SAP Digital Manufacturing
  21. SAP Digital Manufacturing 25.08 Release enhancements and new capabilities
  22. Joule in SAP Digital Manufacturing

This blog post will be continuously updated, as new content is created.

Manoel Costa

entry.title: Re: Can Flexible Workflow Handle Multi-Level CMR Approval...
entry.content: We have the following requirement: CMR < 5,000 → Approved by L2; CMR > 5,000 & < 10,000 → Approved by L2 and L3 ; CMR > 10,000 → Approved by L3 and L4. However, in the Fiori app, the approval steps can only be defined amount-wise at a single level, for example: CMR < 5,000 → Approver L1; CMR > 5,000 & < 10,000 → Approver L2; CMR > 10,000 → Approver L3. As a result, the system behaves accordingly — for example, for a credit memo of 7,000 EUR, it only triggers approval from L2. But our business requirement is based on the 4-eyes principle. For instance, for 7,000 EUR, the document should first be approved by L1, and then by L2. Is it possible to achieve this requirement using standard Flexible Workflow configuration, or do we need to use a BAdI or enhancement to fulfill it?

entry.title: Re: Crystal Report 2009 Vb6 and 32 architecture to migrat...
entry.content:
Hi @prakashchandra 

Thank you for your question.

First, let me confirm that your understanding is correct. You can open old reports, change data sources and fix issues during the upgrade process efficiently.

To enable you upgrade your Crystal Reports from the 2009 version to the latest Crystal Reports 2025, I recommend the following straightforward approach:

First is to open your existing 2009 reports directly in Crystal Reports 2025. The new version supports backward compatibility and will prompt you to upgrade the report format as needed.

Then update and change the data source connections if required.

Thereafter, ensure to thoroughly test your reports and address any issues or warnings that arise during the upgrade.

For multiple reports, ensure to consider tools or scripts to bulk update data source connections and ensure any add-ons or custom integrations are compatible with the new version.

Finally, ensure to always keep backups of your original reports before starting the upgrade.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Crystal Report runtime error when published in Docker
entry.content:
hello all,

I am trying to run an executable made with Crystal Report runtime for Visual Studio Code, where we make a programmatic change to the text object. However, we would like to publish it in Docker.
But when I look at the internal logs inside the container, I am receiving an error (Docker)
MSI (s) (D8:FC) [09:25:37:438]: Product: SAP Crystal Reports runtime engine for .NET Framework (32-bit) -- Installation operation failed.
MSI (s) (D8:FC) [09:25:37:438]: Windows Installer installed the product. Product Name: SAP Crystal Reports runtime engine for .NET Framework (32-bit). Product Version: 13.0.38.5404. Product Language: 1033. Manufacturer: SAP. Installation success or error status: 1603.
Here is the code:

FROM mcr.microsoft.com/windows/servercore:ltsc2019
COPY ./System32/oledlg.dll C:\Windows\System32\oledlg.dll
COPY ./SysWOW64/oledlg.dll C:\Windows\SysWOW64\oledlg.dll
RUN powershell.exe -Command "icacls 'C:\Program Files (x86)\SAP BusinessObjects' /grant 'Everyone:(OI)(CI)F' /T"
COPY CR13SP38MSI32_0-80007712.MSI C:\CRRuntime.msi
RUN powershell.exe -Command "Start-Process msiexec.exe -ArgumentList '/i C:\CRRuntime.msi /qn /norestart ALLUSERS=1 /l*vx C:\cr_install_log.txt' -Wait"
RUN powershell.exe -Command "Remove-Item C:\CRRuntime.msi -Force"
WORKDIR /app
COPY ./publish/ .
CMD ["POC-GROUP.exe"]

The publish folder contains the build that has already been tested locally and works fine with this version of the MSI.

entry.title: In VA01, I do not want the Req Delivery Date to update to the item's first date
entry.content:
Good day,

When I create a Sales Order,  and I immediately change the Req Delivery Date (field: RV45A-KETDAT) to also update the first date of the line items (field:  RV45A-ETDAT).

The Req Delivery Date normally defaults to Today's date, but I want to prevent that the first dates on the item level do not get updated when the user creates the Sales Order and updates the Req Delivery Date immediately. This is to ensure that the materials entered, do not get seen as a future requirement and should be picked up immediately by MRP.  Otherwise I have to configure another MRP type to ignore the delivery lead time.

Any suggestions how I can do this?

The Req Delivery Date we want to use as the Delivery Date we will communicate to the customer as to when their goods will be delivered to them. However the items's first date should be today's date as MRP should immediately be triggered for replenishment.

entry.title: crossboarding- legal entity transfer
entry.content:
Is the statement about cross-boarding still accurate?

Scenarios that require a terminate and rehire process for an internal employee are not supported. For example: An internal employee changes their job from one legal entity to another (either within the same country or a different country).

entry.title: Re: Delivery document type OUTB has the wrong document ca...
entry.content:
Ok in that case, it is almost certainly due to a missing or incorrect mapping in development. Even if the configuration looks the same, the document type-to-category mapping in EWM might differ.

Check this IMG path in EWM > Interfaces → ERP Integration → Delivery Processing → Map Document Types from ERP System to WM System. Make sure Delivery type OUTB is mapped to document category SPC for intra-plant STOs

Compare EWM Mapping Tables between sandbox and development. Use transaction /SCWM/MAPDLVTYP. Confirm that OUTB → SPC mapping exists in development

entry.title: Re: In VA01, I do not want the Req Delivery Date to updat...
entry.content:
By default, when you change the header-level KETDAT, SAP tries to propagate this to the schedule lines (ETDAT). This is controlled by standard logic and ATP checks, which assume the delivery date is also the material requirement date.

Below are some workarounds

  • Use the user exit USEREXIT_MOVE_FIELD_TO_VBEP in program MV45AFZZ to override ETDAT after the user changes KETDAT. In this exit, set VBEP-EDATU (which maps to ETDAT) to SY-DATUM (today’s date). This ensures MRP sees the requirement as immediate, regardless of KETDAT. Be cautious, this logic must only trigger when the order is created or changed in a specific way, to avoid unintended overrides.
  • If you prefer a more modular approach, consider implementing BAdI SD_SALES_ITEM or ATP_CHECK. These allow finer control over schedule line behavior and ATP logic. Most importantly, avoid using MRP types to bypass lead time logic unless absolutely necessary—this can introduce inconsistencies across planning runs

entry.title: Re: Suggestion required for implementing DPC (Dynamic Per...
entry.content:
Hi @diptarkaroy 

Thank you for your message. Let me walk you through it.

Regarding your query about using legacy system consumption values stored in installation facts for DPC bill generation (bill category 3000) in the new SAP S/4HANA system, here is the an approach to evaluate.

First, note that with proper configuration of your billing schema and rate categories, the consumptions stored in installation facts can be used as the basis for billing.

Ensure that your billing schema includes a time slice generator variant, which is designed to write consumption values to installation facts.

The rate categories assigned to the installation must have dynamic period control maintained with appropriate basic categories to use these stored consumptions.

The consumption data from your legacy system and imported via Easy Bill Framework will then serve you as input during DPC bill generation instead of meter readings.

You need to also ensure that the time slice periods align with your consumption data periods for accurate backbilling.

Please note, variants such as Update Sum in the Future may be used to adjust consumption sums and allow correct billing for historical periods.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Customizing for DPC

entry.title: Re: Commission Contract: Copy Control for Conditions
entry.content:
Hi @Dforway1 ,

SAP delivers condition type RCS6. "Condition type RCS6 Commission is the commission condition type that you
also maintain in a condition contract together with accruals in the same condition record." See also CCM_External_Sales_Commissions_Standard_Configuration_2023.pdf.

Assume you have a yearly rebate agreement. Final settlement at the end of the year, no partial settlements, monthly delta accruals. If the customer buys within the year for more than 100000 then the customer gets an 10% rebate on everything that he buys. Let us also assume that the customer buys for 10000 each month and that the same scale is used for the accrual condition as for the settlement condition. The following delta accruals would be posted:

  • January to October: 0
  • November: 11000
  • December: 1000

In November the accruals would be higher than the revenue. That is something nobody wants to see. I have to admit this is an exaggerated example, but in real life accrual conditions with scales might have a drastic impact on how the margin is distributed across the months. Therefore it is best practice for rebate accrual conditions that they are without scales. The accrual condition rate is set so that it matches the estimated rebate settlement / payment. 

Within commissions the base for a scale might be the value of a single transaction, and not the business volume across the whole validity of the condition contract. In this case the scales for settlement and accrual should be the same. In this case you should consider condition type RCS6.

entry.title: Set Batches for child items of a Sales BOM Item in SAP B1 SDK
entry.content:
Dear all

I am facing a challenge where I have to make an A/R Invoice document (through SAP B1 DI API) with some items that have a Sales BoM (Non Inventory Item) and some of the child items of these parent/BoM items are batch managed.

In case of NON-BATCH items, I would just have one line in the document and set parent item code and post the A/R Invoice and it automatically fetches and sets the child items without any issue. But in case of a Batch Managed child items, I get the "Cannot Add Row Without Complete Selection of Batches" error because it expects the batches to be set for the child items.

Now, what I do not understand is that how do I link the the batches of these child items with their item codes/lines. Because, the child lines/items are not fetched/set before the document is posted, it only happens AFTER you post it.

I tried setting the batches for the parent line but that does not work.

I tried manually fetching the child items (with query from ITT1) and adding new rows and set their batches, but even that doesn't work because the actual child items of the parent item are still not getting their batches set.

Also, fetching and setting child items manually just adds additional lines on top of the parent/child combination (verified by posting the draft invoice document). 

So far, the only solution I can think of is that since I can successfully post an A/R Invoice draft (which also fetches and sets the child items of the Sales BoM Item), I should just post draft, fetch it again, and then set the batches. However, that is a longer route and has a higher cost, so, I would want to avoid that. 

Has anyone encountered the above issue and successfully resolved it?

Thanks in advance
Regards

entry.title: Re: Preparation ledger error when running the Consistency...
entry.content:
Hi @florading 

Based on the details you shared, the error message you are experiencing typically indicates an inconsistency in the FI integration settings, which is often caused by missing default fixed asset classes or account determination groups, which might have been deleted or never configured.

I suggest you consider the following to resolve that error:

First, go to the Business Configuration work center, then Access the Overview view.

Open the Fixed Asset Classes fine-tuning activity.

Select Edit Asset Classes and click Restore Defaults to add any missing classes.

Finally, ensure to open the Charts of Accounts, Financial Reporting Structures, Account Determination fine-tuning activity. Then select Edit Account Determination Groups and click Restore Defaults to add missing account determination groups. Make sure to save all changes and rerun the consistency check.

This will restore necessary default values to fix inconsistencies causing the FINCS_MD203 error during the Consistency Check of Settings for your FI Integration.

If the problem persists after restoring defaults, further review of your FI integration customizing and scoping may be needed. The following documentations will be of help.

 

2532689 - Unable to Finalize Scope Changes Due to Inconsistencies in the Business Configuration

Error Messages Explained

SAP Note 2912869

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: RAP - Managed with Unmanaged Save
entry.content:
I know RAP supports Managed with Unmanaged Save scenarios, but in our case we seem to need the opposite.

Our main table is the standard Equipment Master which has to be updated using BAPIs, and we need to create a log table Z_AUDIT to log any changes made to the standard Equipment. So the main entity is the standard I_Equipment, and the new associated z entity is ZI_Equipment_Audit. 

How would you model the RAP root entry view?

define root view entity ZI_Equipment_Audit as 
  select from I_Equipment as Equip
    composition [1..*] of ZI_Audit as _Audit

We need a Managed behaviour for the Audit entity and Unmanaged for the root I_Equipment, because BAPI's are needed to update the standard Equipment master tables. That is not supported by RAP.

What would you suggest in this case?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Looking for Updated SAP C_THR88_2505 Practice Questio...
entry.content:
Hello @archervik 

Thanks for bringing this up; it’s always wise to ensure the material you’re using matches the latest exam version.

For SAP C_THR88_2505 (SuccessFactors Learning), the most dependable resources are the official SAP Learning Hub and SAP Certification Hub, as they are kept up to date with the current exam outline. Within Learning Hub, you’ll find.

  • The Learning Journey: Implementing SAP SuccessFactors Learning

Practice exams and sample questions are available in the SAP Certification Hub

Additional study options:

  • openSAP courses
  • The SAP Community Certification forum, where recent test takers share prep strategies.

Be careful when using third-party dumps; they can sometimes be outdated or unreliable, and they might even go against SAP’s exam policies. It’s always best to stick with trusted sources to ensure you’re well-prepared and following all rules.

Bottom line: Use SAP Learning Hub and Certification Hub for official practice questions and enhance your preparation with openSAP and SAP Community discussions. This way, you ensure you're studying with the most current material for 2025.

Good luck with your exam prep!

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Venor Master (Postal Code related settings)
entry.content:
While via oy17 which is Country specific checks are configured, you can change this, some risks are there in doing that. They are

Data integrity: US postal codes are officially 5 or 9 digits. Allowing other formats may result in incorrect or undeliverable addresses
Integration issues: External systems (e.g., tax engines, logistics providers) may expect valid ZIP formats
Audit and compliance: If postal codes are used for regulatory reporting, incorrect formats could cause issues

entry.title: Is it possible make a CAP Application consume events from EMIS (Integration Suite Event Mesh) ?
entry.content:
Hi CAP community.

I am trying to leverage EMIS (Integration Suite's Event Mesh capability) within a CAP Application. I am following this great video of @ajmaradiaga along side with CAP's documentation (which is not specific to EMIS, but to Standalone Event Mesh service). 

I have successfully set up a queue + topic subscription in EMIS which is receiving events from S/4HANA Public Cloud. I created a service instance of SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh (message-client plan) to provide the credentials to the CAP application (and S4), and bound it both in .cdsrc and mta to feed them at runtime. This is working.

So far so good,  but here is the twist: the bound credentials of the EMIS service don't contain the 'management' object that CAP's messaging service implementation is expecting. See the below error, which is what I am hitting after starting the cap server using

"kind": enterprise-messaging  (or -shared)

options.credentials is correctly bound to EMIS client service key, but no management object exist

I know that when you create an instance of the Standalone SAP Event Mesh service, the keys contain this management object, as stated in the 'documentation'. However, the binding to the EMIS Message Client doesn't:

This makes me wonder: is CAP prepared to integrate with Integration Suite's Event Mesh, or not yet? (CAP documentation doesn't mention this specific use case).

Is there something wrong within my set up?

 

Any help or clue is well appreciated!

Lucho

entry.title: Business Case for Purchasing Deliver Cost
entry.content:
Dear, Gurus.
I have a question regarding Purchasing Delivery Cost.

Let's assume that "A" company purchased goods from company "B" at $100.
Also, company "C" delivered the goods to company "A" at $5.

In this case,  the goods will be $105 when "A" create goods receipt (let's assume that "A" used condition at PO)

And this is my question.
How does company "A" create invoices for goods and delivery cost to each company B & C?

I'd appreciated if you share the knowledge.
And please give me any feedback if there's anything wrong.

entry.title: Re: How can I customize the standard 001 for the Person R...

Before suggesting something, please clarify the following:

  • Are you referring to the default value '001' that appears when creating a work center in transaction CR01/CR02?
  • Do you want to change the default value globally, or just for specific work centers or plant locations? Based on this, the enhancement spot will differ. Also brief as to why you want to change.

entry.title: Re: OpenText Integration with SAP SuccessFactors - Learning Resources Needed
entry.content: Hi Arul, For OpenText integration with SAP SuccessFactors (Employee Central or Onboarding), you can start by checking the SAP Learning Hub, which often has courses on SAP SuccessFactors integration topics. Additionally, OpenText offers documentation and training modules for their connectors and integration scenarios. Regarding certifications, there isn’t a specific accreditation solely for OpenText–SuccessFactors integration, but completing SAP SuccessFactors integration courses and OpenText training can strengthen your knowledge and may be included in broader SAP or OpenText certifications. It’s also helpful to explore SAP Community blogs and Q&A, as practitioners often share step-by-step guides and real-world scenarios.

entry.title: Re: how to setup DVM for EWA
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I would like to contribute to that as well:

  1. The activation steps can be found in SAP Notes 2036442 and 2035999 (see in Attachments section, from page 13/23, chapter 4: New DVM chapter in EWA).
    1. "How to activate Data Volume Management (DVM) relevant sections in the EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) report
      Enter transaction SOLMAN_SETUP in your SAP Solution Manager system. Perform sections "System Preparation", "Basic Configuration" and "Managed Systems Configuration" for the relevant managed system(s). All three sections need to have GREEN ratings for the relevant managed system(s). Enter section "EarlyWatch Alert Management" and perform all steps. In step 5.3 you can activate the Data Volume Management content for the system(s) of interest."
    2. "For activating the new DVM chapter in EWA, the following steps should be followed:
      a) Go to transaction SOLMAN_SETUP (/nSOLMAN_SETUP)
      b) Select the menu Early Watch Alert Management
      c) Go straight to step 5 Configure EWA Content
      d) Select step 5.3 Data Volume Management. Only systems with the TMW RFC Status and Back RFC columns in green can be selected.
      e) Click on the Edit button
      f) Select the System Id and Client combination. You can use the filtering capability to quickly find the right system.
      g) Select the check button under the column DVM Active
      h) Job Scheduling Frequency: Sets up the first run of the configured SID/Client and its frequency. The drop-down available values are: Weekly Monthly
      i) Choose a start date and start time
      j) Select the table line
      k) Click on the button Save       Configuration"
    3. Different options to get DVM insights can be found in the following contents according to each product focus (DVM application based on Solution Manager or DVM App in SAP For Me as per 2868449
      1. 1904491 - Guided Self Service - Data Volume Management (DVM)
      2. 2716655 - How To Use the Data Volume Management APP - Step by Step guide
      3. 2868449 - Data Volume Management App - FAQ
  2. Impacts:
    1. Data Volume Management (DVM) impacts the EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) report by providing insights into data reduction potential through deletion and data archiving recommendations. If DVM is not activated or if the system is a BW system, a comprehensive DVM section cannot be generated in the EWA report. This limitation arises because BW systems lack the necessary time distribution of data, which is essential for calculating data reduction potential. Consequently, the DVM chapter may be missing or not fully informative for BW systems, affecting the overall analysis provided in the EWA report.
    2. A lot of FINS_REC jobs are triggered to run every Monday and consume high CPU, memory according to KBA 3313045
    3. The runtime of the TAANA ANALYSIS and DANA ANALYSIS job can be excessive as these jobs can run in excess of three days depending on the size of table to generate the ST14 dataset completely.
    4. Based on Data_Volume_Management_User_Guide_2020.pdf , page 62/71, chapter 3.7.8 Service Sessions: "Using the GSS Report on systems with very large volumes of data is not recommended, due to the potentially very long run times and the consequent usage of resources such as memory and a background work processes. In these cases, we advocate a different approach. Typically, the GSS report will analyze header tables. In certain cases, it will also analyze line items tables. Line item analysis will take longer in very large systems. So, if you have a very large system it is better to have a strategy in place and then decide which tools (within the DVM launchpad group) support that strategy. Determine what decision you are trying to support, then choose the tool that fits best"

Best regards,
Matheus

entry.title: The Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience - What's New in Q3 2025
entry.content:
The Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience is continuously being refined to better align with customer requirements. On August 14, 2025, a new user experience and content update was implemented for the release navigator. Updates are automatic, yet significant, as they bring new features and content that enhance the usability and functionality of your products from CX portfolio.

In this blog post, we will highlight the key improvements and additions delivered in Q3 2025.

 

Welcome & Release Calendar Cards 

We have refreshed the designs of two key features on the main release navigator page: the Welcome card and the Release Calendar card, each receiving substantial enhancements to improve your overall experience. The Welcome card now features a visually striking themed image, providing an inviting introduction to our platform and establishing an engaging atmosphere. The Release Calendar card has been redesigned for greater clarity, grouping release events by month to facilitate easier navigation through upcoming updates. These upgrades are intended to deliver a clearer, more visually appealing interface that supports an intuitive and user-friendly environment.

 

You will also notice minor UX enhancements, such as differently coloured notifications on the upper bar of all release navigator pages, as well as a slightly more rounded design for information pop-ups located in the release navigator.

Redesigned SAP Commerce Cloud Page

The design of SAP Commerce Cloud has been modified to improve clarity and organisation. The page is now divided into four sections: Updates & News, Documentation, Services & Tools, and Community. In addition to reorganizing existing resources, we have added substantial new content in each section to make the release navigator product page even more convenient for you. These improvements provide comprehensive information to help you stay informed about all updates and developments related to SAP Commerce Cloud.

  •  At the top of the page, you will find already known webcasts, blog posts related to current releases, and other essential information relevant to SAP Commerce Cloud.
  • Below this section is the Documentation area, which features five distinct cards: Commerce Cloud, Storefronts, Services, Accelerators, and Integrations. Each card leads to a dedicated page offering in-depth content specific to that category.
  • The Services & Tools section has been updated to include several new cards: Services Overview, Upgrade Guides, and the newly introduced Framework Update OpenRewrite. With the latest version of SAP Commerce Cloud, the product now supports an updated version of Java, and the Spring Framework has also advanced to its next major release. As both Java and Spring are essential components of SAP Commerce Cloud, we have added the Framework Update OpenRewrite card, which provides resources designed to smooth the upgrade process and minimise overall complexity.
  • The final section, Community, provides links to the Influence Program for submitting product improvement proposals, a Community page for asking questions or accessing blog posts, and a newsletter subscription page to receive your monthly dose of SAP Commerce News delivered directly to your inbox.

 Migrating Customer Data Solutions Content

As you might know the Customer Data Solutions portfolio was transitioned the SAP Business Technology Platform area some time ago. With the upcoming update to the BTP Release Navigator, all Customer Data Solutions content will be migrated accordingly. For your convenience, CDS materials will continue to be available through the Release Navigator for SAP Customer Experience until Q4, after which they are scheduled to be removed from that location.

 

 

The Readiness@Scale is a cross-solution team responsible for release readiness topics in the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Access all the release navigators at Release Ready page and find our team blogs with the tag Readiness@Scale.

If you have any feedback or specific requests regarding the release navigator, we would be more than happy to hear from you. We appreciate all feedback and value your input.

Readiness@Scale with SAP Enterprise Support

Malgorzata Konopelska

entry.title: Cross Model Copy Data Action Different Hierarchy Levels
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to copy Budget data from Tactical Model on Job Family Level to a different model on operational level. The operational model has Job Role with Property Job Family and has level based hierarchy Job Family -> Job Role where as tactical only has Job Family.

I'm using the cross model copy option. when I map the Job Family to job role I don't have an option to map Family to Family. instead what ends up happening is that the data is copied from Job family from tactical model to each job role in the operational model so I end up for example for 3 job roles with 3 of the same budget number. see image below. 

How do I handle this situation so that the budget from job family stops at job family level in operational instead of budget exploding x3 or x4 depending on leaf job roles? 

Thank you

entry.title: Re: Using SAP CPI to Perform POST Calls on SAP Datasphere...
entry.content:
Hello, 

There is no API to ingest data into Datasphere. 
The available options would be via OpenSQL Schema or HDI Containers (not really ingestion but exposing CalcViews for usage in Datasphere). Also, the JDBC Connection as you've already mentioned. 

BR

entry.title: Re: Flexible Workflow in Sales Documents
entry.content:
Can anyone pls help me know this - our requirement is as below: 

  • CMR < 5,000 Euros → Approved by L1

  • CMR > 5,000 & < 10,000 → Approved by L1 & L2

  • CMR > 10,000 → Approved by L2 & L3

How can we achieve this requirement? how can we make it work? any idea pls?
